Comment: This is the Administrator of the Enterprise Single Sign-On (SSO) system
The SSO Affiliate Administrator must be able to create Affiliate Applications.

The BizTalk Server Administrators Group has the least privileges necessary to perform administrative tasks included in the Configuration Framework Wizard and to administer the BizTalk Server environment after installation.
The BizTalk Server Operators Group has the least privileges necessary to perform tasks required for operating the BizTalk Server environment after installation
The BizTalk Server B2B Operators Group has the least privileges necessary to perform tasks required for operating the BizTalk Server B2B environment after installation.
Windows group for accounts with access to the In-Process BizTalk  hosts (hosts processes in the BizTalk Server).
Windows group for accounts with access to the Isolated BizTalk hosts (hosts processes not running on BizTalk Server, such as HTTP and SOAP)
Specify the name of the account under which the Single Sign-On (SSO) service should run. This account must be a member of the SSO Administrator(s) group.
Windows account with access to a specific In-Process BizTalk host instance. This account will be given Log on as Service rights.
Windows account with access to a specific Isolated BizTalk  host instance. This account will be given Log on as Service rights.
Windows account that will have permissions to access the data in the BAM Alerts databases during Business Activity searches.
Windows account that will have permissions to access the data in the BAM Notification Services databases during Business Activity searches.
Windows account that will have permissions to access the data in the BAM Primary Import Database during Business Activity searches.
Identity of the BAM Application Pool.
Notification for the deployment/ undeployment of policies
Address to the SMTP server for Alerts
